Posted By: Joeey (7/5/2012 3:26:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is a nice card, but it's no auto-include. If you're running a casual or modern Bant exalted deck, running 3 colors means you need to be careful on the number of colorless lands your deck has. For standard's White/Black exalted, that problem isn't as big, although you also lose Green which is great for fixing mana. Basically, I love the card, but I don't think my decks want to risk running it.
posts.html:

For standard's White/Black exalted, that problem isn't as big, although you also lose Green which is great for fixing mana. Basically, I love the card, but I don't think my decks want to risk running it.

posts.post_content: I know this card has had something of a lukewarm reception among players, but after playing with it in Limited I am definitely interested in drafting it highly. It reminds me of the lands that can be cycled late-game for precious spells, except this costs nothing and promises to be an immediate threat--big or small depending on your current board position of course. I'd hate to get two of these in an opening hand, but I could be very happy with one.
